items.fromString: json_pure as of 2.0.2 requires Ruby 2 - because Puppet and associates test against many different  versions of ruby, including 1.9.3, we may need to ensure we can still get json_pure without conflicts.

renderedFields.customfield_11803: Added as all Puppet PRs were failing in Travis for ruby 1.9.3
renderedFields.description:
json_pure as of 2.0.2 requires Ruby 2 - because Puppet and associates test against many different versions of ruby, including 1.9.3, we may need to ensure we can still get json_pure without conflicts.
This snipped is going into modules:

gem 'json_pure', '<=2.0.1', :require => false if RUBY_VERSION =~ /^1\./

items.toString: Require for impending Puppet Agent release
This issue links to "GH PR 5140 (Web Link)"

fields.customfield_11803: Require for impending Puppet Agent release
fields.description: Started to use Ruby 2.3 in the Appveypr matrix and on local development and noticed it was failing some tests.  This ticket is to resolve the spec test issues prior to cutting over to 2.3

items.toString: Include agent catalog information (edges, original parameters for example) within a report

items.fromString: Include agent catalog information (edges, original parameters for example) within a report

items.toString: Future changes may cause regression or unintended logic here
Reporting in PE will be incorrect

fields.customfield_12001: Reporting in PE will be incorrect
fields.customfield_12003: Future changes may cause regression or unintended logic here
fields.description: This is necessary for PuppetDB to synchronously process an agent's report and catalog in order to make inferences on deviation between expected and realized state. The easiest thing to do would probably be to stick the catalog under a :catalog key in the report, but more involved format changes could be explored.

renderedFields.customfield_12001: Reporting in PE will be incorrect
renderedFields.customfield_12003: Future changes may cause regression or unintended logic here
renderedFields.description: This is necessary for PuppetDB to synchronously process an agent's report and catalog in order to make inferences on deviation between expected and realized state. The easiest thing to do would probably be to stick the catalog under a :catalog key in the report, but more involved format changes could be explored.

items.fromString:
Managing the passwords for local users under OSX 10.9+ under puppet 4.4.1 fails when setting the salt, iterations and password. 

Steps to re-create:

Used the following command to generate a user definition and saved it to test.pp

puppet resource user test >> test.pp

user { 'test':
  ensure     => 'present',
  comment    => 'test',
  gid        => '20',
  groups     => ['com.apple.sharepoint.group.2'],
  home       => '/Users/test',
  iterations => '46948',
  password   => '9690da8dd8f90f6e3fed4f267c86110e29d75e8448efdacdee9bd5cc20f81a563c9e6c6c328694fac80910ba99508cc373525ac592b87fbec0ac1a1e26a51f01873c25f2450aa78e09c8498df0f11fa930c3f655e7aeed6bc61e8475ca84297b3a2273d31974ddd232e872d9b66be82d0246d094d60155c93c6b7a27ba1aa390',
  salt       => '62133b77a7aeecf506ffe99d064b3f8c068344de0a619a573a871f2fd6fe9eaf',
  shell      => '/bin/bash',
  uid        => '503',
}

When running puppet apply on the following definition I get the following errors:

Error: "\x96" on UTF-8
Error: /Stage[main]/Main/User[test]/password: change from [old password hash redacted] to [new password hash redacted] failed: "\x96" on UTF-8

Error: "\xA7" on UTF-8
Error: /Stage[main]/Main/User[test]/salt: change from 6f13b4510093e89a0098eff8ee5d4bae3e1314ebf31064c101cd886ad8c2fab6 to 62133b77a7aeecf506ffe99d064b3f8c068344de0a619a573a871f2fd6fe9eaf failed: "\xA7" on UTF-8

Error: "\xD2" followed by "\x01" on UTF-8
Error: /Stage[main]/Main/User[test]/iterations: change from 43290 to 46948 failed: "\xD2" followed by "\x01" on UTF-8

items.fromString: This was working without issue under puppet 3.

  ensure     => 'present',
  comment    => 'test',
  home       => '/Users/test',
  iterations => '46948',
  password   => '9690da8dd8f90f6e3fed4f267c86110e29d75e8448efdacdee9bd5cc20f81a563c9e6c6c328694fac80910ba99508cc373525ac592b87fbec0ac1a1e26a51f01873c25f2450aa78e09c8498df0f11fa930c3f655e7aeed6bc61e8475ca84297b3a2273d31974ddd232e872d9b66be82d0246d094d60155c93c6b7a27ba1aa390',

  shell      => '/bin/bash',

fields.customfield_12100: directoryservice user provider was failing to set password and salt under certain circumstances on OSX
fields.description:
Managing the passwords for local users under OSX 10.9, 10.10 and 10.11 under puppet 4.4.1 fails when setting the salt, iterations and password. 

Steps to re-create:

Used the following command to generate a user definition and saved it to test.pp

{code}
puppet resource user test >> test.pp
{code}

{code:puppet}
user { 'test':
  ensure     => 'present',
  comment    => 'test',
  gid        => '20',
  groups     => ['com.apple.sharepoint.group.2'],
  home       => '/Users/test',
  iterations => '46948',
  password   => '9690da8dd8f90f6e3fed4f267c86110e29d75e8448efdacdee9bd5cc20f81a563c9e6c6c328694fac80910ba99508cc373525ac592b87fbec0ac1a1e26a51f01873c25f2450aa78e09c8498df0f11fa930c3f655e7aeed6bc61e8475ca84297b3a2273d31974ddd232e872d9b66be82d0246d094d60155c93c6b7a27ba1aa390',
  salt       => '62133b77a7aeecf506ffe99d064b3f8c068344de0a619a573a871f2fd6fe9eaf',
  shell      => '/bin/bash',
  uid        => '503',
}
{code}


When running puppet apply on the above definition I get the following errors:

{code}
Error: "\x96" on UTF-8
Error: /Stage[main]/Main/User[test]/password: change from [old password hash redacted] to [new password hash redacted] failed: "\x96" on UTF-8

Error: "\xA7" on UTF-8
Error: /Stage[main]/Main/User[test]/salt: change from 6f13b4510093e89a0098eff8ee5d4bae3e1314ebf31064c101cd886ad8c2fab6 to 62133b77a7aeecf506ffe99d064b3f8c068344de0a619a573a871f2fd6fe9eaf failed: "\xA7" on UTF-8

Error: "\xD2" followed by "\x01" on UTF-8
Error: /Stage[main]/Main/User[test]/iterations: change from 43290 to 46948 failed: "\xD2" followed by "\x01" on UTF-8
{code}

fields.description:
When a package updates it's sysvinit script or systemd unit (or for that matter if I were to be manually managing a systemd unit with a file resource), nothing ever tells systemd to check for changed units. 

Typically you would invoke `systemctl daemon-reload` to scan for new and changed units.

fields.summary: Systemd provider doesn't scan for changed units

links.label: Agile Board
links.title: View this issue on an Agile board

header.label: Export
header.title: Export this issue in another format

renderedFields.description:
When a package updates it's sysvinit script or systemd unit (or for that matter if I were to be manually managing a systemd unit with a file resource), nothing ever tells systemd to check for changed units.

Typically you would invoke `systemctl daemon-reload` to scan for new and changed units.
